context: The chemical analysis results also revealed the presence of phthalate ester, particularly bis(2-ethylhexyl)phthalate and di-octyl phthalate, which are used extensively as plasticizing agents in rubber manufacturing. On the other hand, various nitroso- and aromatic-amines (for example N-nitrosomorpholine and N-nitrosodimethylamine), which have been identified as the major carcinogens in tire industry (Spiegelhalder, 1983; Fajen et al., 1979), were not positively identified in the present air samples. Regarding toxicological potentials, the health hazards associated with exposures to ketones, aliphatic and aromatic hydrocarbons are well documented. Benzothiazole has been found to cause eye, skin and respiratory irritation and skin sensitization (Fishbein, 1991), and is carcinogenic to rats (NTP, 1988). Meanwhile, phthalate ester is a peroxisome proliferator and non-mutagenic carcinogen in rodents (Fracasso et al., 1999; Gibson, 1993). Mutagenic properties are the major concerns for various PAHs. The PAHs identified in the current air samples, specifically 1-methyl-naphthalene, were found to be mutagenic in S. typhimurium assay, while naphthalene and dimethyl-naphthalenes were not (Kaden et al., 1979).Particulates Average total particulate levels measured in the four different locations in the tire-shredding plants range from 0.43 to 6.54 mg/m3 (Table 2 ).
